channel.title: Staff Cape Error

item.title: Staff Cape Error
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Because you used space bar. You use tab in .cfg files.

Read full topic

item.title: Staff Cape Error
item.dc:creator: @nickog15 nickog15
item.description:
@nickog15 wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

If the item name contains platebody and you add that to Item.cfg, it goes to platebody. If you have a total new name for an item you want to go on the chest, then yes you do add it to item.java under the chest void. You guys don’t realize the reading the ints he has, being capes, are given. He dosen’t need to add anything into Item.java or ItemAssitant.java, just Item.cfg as the item name already contains “cape.” With that said, stop trying to make this harder for him then it already is.

thx for saying that but i did it all and this is what comes up when i comple and hit ‘run’

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 17 at server.world.ItemHandler.loadItemList(ItemHandler.java:377) at server.world.ItemHandler.(ItemHandler.java:34) at server.Server.(Server.java:62) Press any key to continue . . .
i added the stuff into item.cfg and got this

Read full topic

item.title: Staff Cape Error
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

If the item name contains platebody and you add that to Item.cfg, it goes to platebody. If you have a total new name for an item you want to go on the chest, then yes you do add it to item.java under the chest void. You guys don’t realize the reading the ints he has, being capes, are given. He dosen’t need to add anything into Item.java or ItemAssitant.java, just Item.cfg as the item name already contains “cape.” With that said, stop trying to make this harder for him then it already is.

Read full topic

item.title: Staff Cape Error
item.dc:creator: @nickog15 nickog15
item.description:
@nickog15 wrote:

im using insidiaX for source & client.

Read full topic

item.title: Staff Cape Error
item.dc:creator: @CoreVersion CoreVersion
item.description:
@CoreVersion wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:19, topic:420026”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=522583.msg3800661#msg3800661 date=1319994663]
Making it go in the right slot is server sided in ItemAssistant.java.
[/quote]Nah its not dude. Just add the item name next to the given code in Item.cfg[/quote]

Making items go into certain slots IS server-sided.
item.cfg wont do anything, all it will do is add the other half of examine and the names for things like shops/trading etc.
It can set prices for items, and set their bonuses.

Changing slots is server-sided and is in item.java, or itemassistant.java

Read full topic

item.title: Staff Cape Error
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

OMFG You guys are stupid. The dude who gave you the other ints were for PI. You are using Delta which is class8. Find the item list server sided and add the item name in next to their given item code. Derpus. :fp:

Read full topic

item.title: Staff Cape Error
item.dc:creator: @nickog15 nickog15
item.description:
@nickog15 wrote:

Ok so im trying to add 3 staff capes into my server.(mod,admin,owner)
This is the ‘mod’ cape code:

if(i == 13677) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anInt174 = 14125; //Inv & Ground class8.anInt181 = 2000; //Zoom class8.anInt190 = 572; class8.anInt198 = 0; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = 1; class8.anInt165 = 14126; //Male class8.anInt200 = 14126; //Female class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.anInt199 = -1;//noteable class8.aString170 = "Moderator cape"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Its A moderator Cape".getBytes(); }
and this is it after i put it through int renamer (class8>itemdef)
if(i == 13677) { itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wear"; itemDef.anInt174 = 14125; //Inv & Ground itemDef.modelZoom = 2000; //Zoom itemDef.modelRotation1 = 572; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 0; itemDef.anInt204 = 0; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 1; itemDef.anInt165 = 14126; //Male itemDef.anInt200 = 14126; //Female itemDef.anInt175 = -1; itemDef.anInt197 = -1; itemDef.anInt199 = -1;//noteable itemDef.name = "Moderator cape"; itemDef.description = "Its A moderator Cape".getBytes(); }
and this is it after i edit it a lil to make it fit into my itemdef so it would accept it
case 13677: itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear"; itemDef.modelZoom = 2000; //Zoom itemDef.modelRotationX = 572; itemDef.modelRotationY = 0; itemDef.anInt204 = 0; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 1; itemDef.anInt204 = 0; itemDef.anInt165 = 14126; //Male itemDef.anInt200 = 14126; //Female itemDef.anInt175 = -1; itemDef.anInt197 = -1; itemDef.name = "Moderator cape"; itemDef.description = "Its A moderator Cape"; break;
so the problem is for one, it does not go into the cape slot, it goes into the platebody slot and the picture of it in the invt. is a picture of a seed or something (yes my #'s are correct with my model numbers) Help please://?
